title: Poster, "Il Mondo della Luna", 1997
provenance: Marc Benda (acquired new and directly from designers, museums, and cultural institutions); 2010: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Sara and Marc Benda
description:
Background: large grey-and-white plane at right joins a lighter grey-and-white plane at left on a diagonal, terminating at a third plane at bottom, in faded blue. Through this room-like arrangement, "windows" are cut: one rectangular at left and one crescent-shaped in center, opening to photographs of the Universe, while a photograph of Earth emerges from the lower blue plane. Seated on the crescent-shaped window is a woman, tinted yellow, half-covered with blue drapery, caressed by a man, tinted fuchsia, who appears as only a facial profile and a hand. 
Inscriptions: the tile, at top center- " IL MONDO DELLA LUNA", at bottom- "OPENHAS ZURICH ZU GAST IM THEATER AM STADTGARTEN WINTERTHUR",  and credits at lower right- " von Josef Hayden / Adam Fischer / Matthias Schohefeldt / Kersten Paulsen / Stadtorchester Winterthur / [...] / ab 4. september".

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Il Mondo della Luna", 1997. Screenprint on wove paper. Gift of Sara and Marc Benda. 2010-21-58.
